w.t: to prepare a place for building
to help without expectation of reward
to put out big spreading branches
one who doesn't do as be hears he should
to return from war, from giving aid
place to offer to the gods
bits or pieces of paper or cloth
gutaha ubukwe - to go to wedding feast
uk'umwaka utashe - at the end of every year
to cause to cry for help
kwitangira itama - to put one's face in one's hands in deep thought
to become light suddenly (early morning just as darkness ends, or after eclipse)
kwitamba ku muvyimba - to make it hard for one who has lost a loved one by reproaching the dead one, to make light of serious things, to gloat over (reference to death)
child (before he begins to know anything)
to put in the mouth of
to be beyond what one can do
to be unable to do what one attempts
to accuse each other of spoiling a plan
to bar the path for each other
to send workers some to one place and some to another
to put near fire to dry
to put beer in a warm place
to argue and swear that you're right
to take one's case to chief knowing you're right
to refuse to listen (almost like a crazy person)
to send one out of the room
to try over and over in several places and ways
to begin to rain (after dry season)
something supposed to be in a person making him sick
indwara y'ibitega - person is bewitched and acts like a crazy person
something put away for future use
to be obliged to adopt the less desirable of two plans
to have several plans of what to do so that at least one will please the other people
to have two methods of defending yourself, but use the one you hadn't planned on
amateka - word (or commands) sent out by king and spread by chiefs, subchiefs, etc.
to prepare things for a trip
the pain from tropical ulcer (one that develops rapidly)
to cut up small as reeds, boards, etc.
to burn and break off (as tree, log (v.i.)
to be loaded with fruit or grain (tree, stalk)
to not keep at the job faithfully
to begin to feel better after being ill
gutera imbere - to go forward,to make progress
to help plant (throw in the beans as other lifts soil)
to cause to or help to plant
guteranura umunwa - to open the mouth
to come one by one till there are many
to put a thing in its certain place
to move sonething to another place
to go together to procure food for guests
to help one another in loaning what is needed
one in charge of food at a feast
to lift up at, for, because of
to lift up by means of
pieces of a certain kind of grass used for weaving
bits of things used by witch doctor to divine
to make another feel badly over something he's done
to be easily deceived or mocked
to tremble (of hands, from cold or fever, fear)
to be thoroughly drenched and cold
to be drawn up from cold or being burnt
to dry up and be stiff (food, clothes)
to be absolutely full to brim
to be very healthy or strong, solid, dry
to be speechless with shame or fear
to dry (esp. with fire, as corn or grain)
to throw or cause by means of
to not keep at the job faithfully
to fail to keep one's promise
to let go of what you've started to take or do
to tell fairy tales (stories passed down from long ago)
to pay no attention to anything
gucurira intimba - to sing (or play) sad song
that which is feared or respected
to borrow (a thing which will itself be returned)
to dislocate (either parts of body, or other things) (v.i.)
to lend for, in the place of
to be worn out (of soil, no longer produce)
to cause people to hate that which they had liked
to cause to lose original force
to lend (that which will itself be returned)
to have dirt in (as water or milk)
to pick (peas, beans, berries) but not pull up vines
to pick (peas, beans. etc. ) for, at
to become green (as grass when rains begin)
to become green (as grass when rains begin)
to cut down trees left after fire has passed over
to leave grass and stuff growing in rugo
to lend something and not get it back soon
to entrust something to another and it increases while there
to let fall drop by drop
to cause to fall drop by drop
to pick up here and there
to add to little by little
to remove a foreign article from eye (or, from water, milk)
to have article taken from eye
to sprinkle "medicine" around to protect from evil
to go along right in path (of animals)
to put ground peanuts in food
foreign article in eye, milk, water
to select a person to sell a thing or to bring tax
to stay in one place permanently
to be made to stumble by
to grow smaller (sometimes used of moon)
to grow larger (sometimes used of moon)
to yell at each other hateful things
to hit repeatedly but gently with fist (mother sometimes does it to child)
trunk of tree or person or animal
to swell (esp. of dead animals, also of beans, etc.)
trunk of banana tree after banana is cut
to be directly in front of, looking toward
to tell what one has heard while eavesdropping
to be a widow (of chief, etc.)
to lean forward preparing to run
to move things to another place
stones, nails, etc., which witch doctor pretends to take from swollen place on body
gutura hasi - to knock down (esp. in a fight)
to make a loud frightening noise
to sit together talking for a long time
food and drink of rich man (ruler), (esp. honey)
to chase others out of home
to push a person down where he belongs
to lead (e.g. cows out to pasture)
to be impossible to dig even though water is on top
person of upper class of Barundi (Nilotic origin)
to take dry leaves out of banana trees
to drop voice at end of sentence or expression
one who has power, goodness, courage
child (before he begins to know anything)
